text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

My life's purpose is
to leave this earth
better than I found it.

I truly live by the
quote from Maya Angelou

that, "People
forget what you say,

they will forget what
you do, but they never
forget how you made them feel."

And that, connected
with a quote I
was given when I was in a band--
proud band nerd, by the way.

I was a drum major
in high school.

And the quote that always
sticks with me is "Good leaders

make you love and
respect you like them.

Great leaders make you
love and respect yourself."

And I think the two
of those combined
are the tenets that I live by.

That I am on this earth,
on this planet, to help
bring more light.

So that looks like
how I enter a space.

I have a natural optimism
and I don't dampen that.

When I meet new people,
I want to create

that warmth, that
welcoming energy that you
are important because you are.
I will speak.
I will say, hi.

I will remember your pet's
name, and when your birthday

is, because that to me
is how you feel included
and like you belong.
And it can sound small.
It can sound simple.
But, to me, it's huge.

And I think that combined
with the privileges,

and the opportunities
I've been blessed to have,
I don't take those for granted.

Even being at Harvard
Business School, which

is a dream above all dreams, I
don't take any day for granted.
You can ask my friends.
You can ask my families.

I have blown them up with
fun facts out of the wazoo

because, in addition
to being a light,

I think my life's
purpose is to live -

live my life to its fullest,
every day, every week,
every season.

To love - love my family,
my friends, strangers.
And to give.

And that goes back to my point
of sharing these fun facts.

I have so much to
give, and I would not

be fulfilling my life's
purpose without doing all three
of those things.

So if I had to summarize what
my life's purpose is in a one

sentence TL;DR, I would say,
my life's purpose is to be

a bright spot while
always sharing the truth.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
